root.name: print()
root.description: Writes to the console area of the Processing environment. This is often helpful for looking at the data a program is producing. The companion function println() works like print(), but creates a new line of text for each call to the function. Individual elements can be separated with quotes ("") and joined with the addition operator (+) except when printing array data.

parameter.label: data
parameter.description: boolean, byte, char, color, int, float, String, boolean[], byte[], char[], color[], int[], float[], or String[]
